alert.note: Alert for Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued September 27 at 8:08PM EDT until September 28 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT THURSDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one foot of inundation above ground level in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...The coasts of Monmouth County and Ocean County in New Jersey. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through Thursday evening. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 1:00 AM Thursday. * IMPACTS...At this level, flooding begins on the most vulnerable roads in coastal and bayside communities, and along inland tidal waterways. Some partial or full road closures are possible. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Water levels will remain elevated into the weekend, with minor or near minor tidal flooding possible with the nighttime high tides on Thursday, Friday and Saturday. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Sandy Hook Bay at Sandy Hook MLLW Categories - Minor 6.7 ft, Moderate 7.7 ft, Major 8.7 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.5 ft, Moderate 2.5 ft, Major 3.5 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 27/07 PM 6.9 1.7 0.9 Minor 28/07 AM 6.5 1.3 0.7 None 28/08 PM 7.0 1.8 0.9 Minor 29/08 AM 7.1 1.9 1.0 Minor 29/09 PM 7.1 1.9 1.0 Minor 30/09 AM 7.2 2.0 0.9 Minor Watson Creek at Manasquan MLLW Categories - Minor 5.7 ft, Moderate 6.7 ft, Major 7.7 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.3 ft, Moderate 2.3 ft, Major 3.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 27/07 PM 6.0 1.6 0.5 Minor 28/07 AM 5.6 1.2 0.4 None 28/08 PM 6.2 1.8 0.6 Minor 29/08 AM 6.2 1.8 0.6 Minor 29/08 PM 6.0 1.6 0.5 Minor 30/09 AM 6.3 1.9 0.6 Minor Barnegat Bay at Barnegat Light MLLW Categories - Minor 3.5 ft, Moderate 4.5 ft, Major 5.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.0 ft, Moderate 2.0 ft, Major 3.0 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 27/07 PM 3.9 1.4 0.9 Minor 28/07 AM 3.5 1.0 0.6 Minor 28/08 PM 3.7 1.2 0.7 Minor 29/08 AM 3.7 1.2 0.7 Minor 29/08 PM 3.6 1.1 0.6 Minor 30/09 AM 3.8 1.3 0.7 Minor &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Conditions in the surf are extremely dangerous. Stay out of the water.
